tl.Util

Class TBitMask

  • java.lang.Object
    • tl.Util.TBitMask

  • public class TBitMask
extends java.lang.Object
    TBitMask is a class used for storing and manipulating multiple bits in a single byte.
    Bits can be pushed, popped, toggled, flipped en mass, and returned.
    Since:
    2.1
    Author:
    Callum Nichols

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TBitMask()
      Default constructor, for starting with an empty mask.
      TBitMask(byte value)
      Constructor, used to set an initial value.
      TBitMask(TBitMask mask)
      Copy constructor, used to set an initial value.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void flip()
      Simple function that flips all the bits in the mask (inverts it).
      byte getBit(byte index)
      Returns a value specified at an index.
      boolean[] getBits()
      Returns the value as an array of each of the value's bits (from right to left).
      byte getValue()
      Returns the whole value of the mask.
      byte pop()
      Shifts the mask to the right by 1 and returns the truncated bit.
      E.g.
      void push(boolean option)
      Shifts the mask to the left by 1 and sets the first bit.
      E.g.
      void setBit(byte index, boolean option)
      Sets a bit at a specified index to a specific value.
      void setValue(byte value)
      Sets the mask to a specific value.
      void setValue(TBitMask mask)
      Sets the mask to the value of another TBitMask.
      void toggleBit(byte index)
      Flips a single bit determined by an index.

    • Method Detail

      • push

        public void push(boolean option)
        Shifts the mask to the left by 1 and sets the first bit.
        E.g.

         TBitMask mask = new TBitMask(10);
 mask.push(true); // mask was 1010(10), is now 10101(21), pushed 1
        Parameters:
        option - - The option to push to the end of the mask.
        See Also:
        pop()

      • pop

        public byte pop()
        Shifts the mask to the right by 1 and returns the truncated bit.
        E.g.

         TBitMask mask = new TBitMask(10);
 mask.pop(); // mask was 1010(10), is now 101(5), returned 0
        Returns:
        - The bit that was truncated from the mask (1 or 0).
        See Also:
        push(boolean)

      • flip

        public void flip()
        Simple function that flips all the bits in the mask (inverts it).

      • toggleBit

        public void toggleBit(byte index)
               throws TException
        Flips a single bit determined by an index. Throws an exception if the index is < 0 or > 7.
        Parameters:
        index - - The index in the mask to be flipped.
        Throws:
        TException
        See Also:
        flip()

      • setBit

        public void setBit(byte index,
          boolean option)
            throws TException
        Sets a bit at a specified index to a specific value. Throws an exception if the index is < 0 or > 7.
        Parameters:
        index - - The index in the mask to be set.
        option - - The bit to be given to the bit at the index.
        Throws:
        TException
        See Also:
        getBit(byte)

      • getBit

        public byte getBit(byte index)
            throws TException
        Returns a value specified at an index. Throws an exception if the index is < 0 or > 7.
        Parameters:
        index - - The index in the mask to be returned.
        Returns:
        - The bit at the index (1 or 0).
        Throws:
        TException
        See Also:
        setBit(byte, boolean), getBits()

      • getBits

        public boolean[] getBits()
        Returns the value as an array of each of the value's bits (from right to left).
        Returns:
        - The bits as a boolean array.
        See Also:
        getBit(byte), getValue()

      • setValue

        public void setValue(byte value)
        Sets the mask to a specific value.
        Parameters:
        value - - The value to be set to.
        See Also:
        setValue(TBitMask), getValue()

      • setValue

        public void setValue(TBitMask mask)
        Sets the mask to the value of another TBitMask.
        Parameters:
        mask - - The bit mask to copy from.
        See Also:
        setValue(byte), getValue()

      • getValue

        public byte getValue()
        Returns the whole value of the mask.
        Returns:
        - The value of this TBitMask.
